title: Michael Schott Memorial Circuit Race
description:
Michael Schott Memorial Circuit Race
CCB Racing's annual spring Road Race - Marblehead Ma. April 3, 2016
http://www.ccbracing.com/content/michael-schott-memorial-circuit-race-marblehead-0
course: 2.2 mile fast/rolling circuit around Marblehead Neck
registration: www.BikeReg.com - Michael Schott Memorial Circuit Race
directions:
Directions:
Take 128 North or South to 114 East (Exit 25A, Marblehead, and Salem).  At your second set of lights after coming off of 128, take a left (you'll see a gas station on your right) and then follow 114 East through Salem, past Salem State College, into Marblehead, approximately 6 miles.  Turn Right (at Fire Station) onto Ocean Ave, go through 1 set of lights, the registration area (Devereaux Beach) will 1/4 mile ahead on the right.

title: Myles Standish State Forest Road Race
My First Road Bike Camp
description:
This three-day mini-camp will cover the finer points of road riding. You will learn how to ride in pacelines, echelons and groups. Climbing technique, descending skills and road etiquette will be demystified. Your days will be spent executing specific skills and workouts, and evenings will include short seminars explaining the techniques and goals of each day. You will be introduced to proper bike fit and you'll learn about the essentials of bike maintenance. Most of all, you'll have a great time ensconced in the beautiful sport of cycling in one of the best spots in the world to enjoy it.
This camp is designed for those who are either recently converted to riding a road bike or those who have some experience and are looking for a structured approach to learning the skills that will make cycling that much more enjoyable. Participants should bring a road bike (with drop bars) and have a basic fitness level that allows them to enjoy rides of 35+ miles over varying terrain.

Attendees will arrive in Northampton on Thursday evening, June 9, and depart on the afternoon of Sunday, June 12, 2016. The camp includes accommodations at The Hotel Northampton, The Fairfield Inn, the Autumn Inn or the Northampton Quality Inn & Suites (formerly the Best Western Northampton), a hearty breakfast and lunch each day of the camp, as well as written materials to support the coaching. To assure personal attention, each camp is limited to 8 attendees.

title: B2VT Ride
description: 2016 will be the 16th annual edition of the B2VT ride (formerly known as the B2B). In 2014 the course was altered to accommodate the new start and finish points but still contained most of the original B2B course (but was even more hilly!). The 2016 B2VT Ride will continue to be one of the most challenging single day rides in New England. By design, it is not for everyone.  This ride is for cyclists who are physically and mentally tough, don’t whine, excel in the face of challenges, know the rules of the road and can ride 130+ miles to the finish safely and without their hands being held.

title: Sanderson Academy Bike-a-Thon
description: Bike-a-thon to support music programming at Sanderson Academy (local public school).
course: A loop which starts in downtown Ashfield, heads south on 116, takes a right on Creamery Rd, Right on Norton Hill, Right at Elmer's store and off you go again. The challenge is the century, 24 laps, 11,500' of climbing
registration: Ashfield town green for registration, family fun and music performances. RaceWire to do the timing. They will provide open timing from 9-5. This means one could come and ride all day or just a few hours in the middle of the day. They will tally number of miles ridden and submit results to BikeReg.
notes: There is no race component to this event.
directions: Rte 116 North to Center of Ashfield

title: Vittoria Eastern States Cup Thunder Mountain DH Race
Dusk to Dawn
description:
We’re riding mixed-terrain in the dark.  All night.  It's that simple; it's just not easy.

This ride is truly like no other ride we've found.  This is out third annual mixed-terrain event that rolls from sun to sun.

Own the night.

 June 25 & 26, 2016. From sunset on Saturday through sunrise on Sunday.  We depart at 8:25 pm -- sunset -- on Saturday evening.
course:
As the name stipulates:  Riding from dusk to dawn.  Actually, not to get too technical but really we’re riding from sundown to sunrise.  The ride is a set distance and you ride until you’re done.  A few people might make it to the finish before dawn but most riders are likely to see the sunrise along the course.  In addition to night riding, it’s important to know that about 50% of the ride will be on dirt - dirt roads, singletrack, fire roads, goat paths, and other terra incognita.

Distance:  About 90-miles
Elevation Gain:  About 6,500 feet
Terrain:  Mixed.  60% dirt; 40% pavement
Geography:  Suburban and some urban
Territory:  From deep woods to well traveled roads
Sky:  Dark
registration:
Register at https://www.bikereg.com/dusk-to-dawn-2016

Pre-Dusk Registration - from April 1 - June 7:  $95
Dark Registration - from June 8 - June 19:  $125

Value:  More than you’re expecting.  This ride asks for a lot.  In return, we offer a lot.  Once you register for the Dusk to Dawn you will receive all the details you need to have a fun, safe, and memorable ride with us.  Here is a partial list of what you'll receive:

Too much food:  Pre-ride dinner, two late-night food stops, and post-ride breakfast.  All more food that anyone could possibly eat on a 10-hour ride.
Comprehensive ride support.  You won’t ever be too far from an organized stop, the service vehicle, and other riders.
A warm fire, warm food, and clean toilets at the mid-ride stop.
More caffeine that you’ll know what to do with.
Mandatory 3+ hour training ride night roll on dates to be shared once you've registered.  Fun for all.
Memories like no others.

In addition to what you would bring with you for any 10-hour night ride, and in addition to the entry fee, there are two items we require participants to have.  Make sure you're up for the investment before registering for the Dusk to Dawn Ride.

Own or rent a SPOT Tracker.  We can manage the sourcing of the SPOT if you'd like; rental of the SPOT Tracker from OBC is $50.  The SPOT device provides OBC the ability to keep track of your progress and find you if you get in trouble.  The SPOT also provides the option of public tracking, so your friends can follow your progress throughout night, if you'd like. 
Use a GPS Device that will get you through up to 14-hours of riding time.  The only way to navigate the route is with a dedicated GPS device -- like a Garmin 1000 or similar unit.  A Garmin 510 or lower is not recommended.  Anything from a 705 and up will be adequate -- from a routing standpoint but not necessarily from a battery life standpoint.
notes:
Dusk to Dawn offers three ride divisions:

Continuous Solo:  This division rolls all night long - continuously for the full 90-miles, with a few refueling stops along the way - including the Big Fire at about 55-miles.
Camp Out:  This division rides about 55-miles to the Big Fire stop and then camps out for the evening.  Once the sun rises - or anytime before 10 am - you hop in the van or ride home on 23 easy miles of road.  This is a good test of your bikepacking equipment.
Continuous Teams that consist of 3 - 8 riders:  Everyone on each team starts and finishes together.  All team members roll through each feed station together.  Teams require only one SPOT transponder for the entire group; this saves each team member between $33 and $43 in SPOT rental fees. To register a team, include each participant's name in the notes field when registering. Also supply a team name.
directions: Ride departs from Ride Studio Cafe in Lexington.

title: Root 66 DomnarskiFarm.com 2016
description: Pre-Registration closes NOON Thursday, June 23rd, 2016. The reg fee will go up to $40 on race day. For mail in registrations address to: Domnarski Farm, 77 Bacon Road, Ware MA 01082. Registrations must be post marked by June 20, 2016  Save yourself more $ by also registering for a number plate good for the whole year:  https://www.bikereg.com/root-66-race-plates
course:
It's a great course rain OR shine!!! Trail is a variety of packed singletrack/ ATV and jeep trails and well ridden!  There is even a 0.5 miles pavement.  Bring two tubes, run pressure high to prevent snakebite flats.  Durable equipment and climbing gears highly recommended.  Pre-rides before race day encouraged.

First Timer/Beginner Loop 3.35 miles: http://connect.garmin.com/activity/25346710 Sport thru Pro Loop 10.00 miles:  http://connect.garmin.com/activity/111502491
notes:
It's a great course rain OR shine!!! Trail is a variety of packed singletrack/ ATV and jeep trails and well ridden!  There is even a 0.5 miles pavement.  Bring two tubes, run pressure high to prevent snakebite flats.  Durable equipment and climbing gears highly recommended.  Pre-rides before race day encouraged.

First Timer/Beginner Loop 3.35 miles: http://connect.garmin.com/activity/25346710 Sport thru Pro Loop 10.00 miles:  http://connect.garmin.com/activity/111502491
directions: Directions:  Massachusetts Turnpike, take the Palmer Exit 8 to Route 32 North.  Bacon Road is the first right when you enter Ware from Palmer (6 miles from the Turnpike).  Follow signs to parking.  www.RandMcNalley.com 77 Bacon Road 01082 cell 413-426-8040.

title: Nomad Three Day Bikepacking Adventure Ride
description:
The Nomad Three Day Bikepacking Adventure Ride is precisely what it claims:  Three days of mixed-terrain adventure riding in the nomad style.  We're moving campsites each of the two overnights -- and we carry with us everything we need to have an amazing adventure.

For us, it's difficult to imagine a more fun ride than this.  It's a compact amount of time, it's all very rideable for experienced mixed-terrain riders, it gets us out in nature to decompress from the world around us, and we get to eat tons of food around a big campfire.  That's all we could possibly want.  We hope you feel the same way.

Join us for this simple group bikepacking ride that brings us back to nature.

If you haven't done a bikepacking trip before, this is a great way to start.  This is a fully supported event -- we have the campgrounds ready to go, we've got roving support vehicles, and we've got all the food worked out.  You just have to pedal and enjoy an amazing weekend that will have you hooked on bikepacking.
course:
Friday, July 8:  We depart at 6:30 pm and ride about 30-miles of mixed terrain, until dark, to the first campsite.  Dinner and a big fire will be waiting for you.   

Saturday, July 9:  Breakfast will be served beginning at 7:30 am.  We pack up and depart at 10:30 am.  We ride mixed-terrain all day until we arrive at the evening's next campsite by dusk.  We once again have an amazing dinner and fire for you.

Sunday, July 10:  One last big breakfast before we head back out onto the trail.  We're back to the start point by 4pm.
registration:
Register at Bikereg.com.  

Friday evening includes dinner, campsite, and breakfast:  $35.
Saturday evening includes dinner, campsite, and breakfast:  $35.
Friday and Saturday evening:  $60.
notes:
You Are Responsible For Bikepacking With:
Tent or whatever you want to sleep in
Sleeping bag or however you plan to sleep
Anything else you think you want to carry.  Once you register we will send you a list of all the items we tend to carry on multi-day bikepacking adventures.
Eating and drinking utensils.  We're providing all the food; you provide the containers from which to eat hot foods.  We'll provide you a recommended list once you register.
Multi-day riding toolkit and repair supplies.

title: Jeremy Powers JAM Fund Grand Fundo
18th Annual NCC Tour of the Hilltowns
description:
The 18th Annual Tour of the Hilltowns
Saturday, July 23, 2016
Presented by: Northampton Cycling Club
course: Course: a 94.5mi. double loop with 3 major climbs and 2 feed zones for the P/1/2 category and a 53.9mi. loop with two major climbs and one feed zone for all other categories. Start and finish at Notchview Reservation on Rt. 9 in Windsor, MA.
registration:
Juniors race for $5 regardless of category entered. Juniors can preregister for their category and request a rebate at registration.
Masters races are Cat 1-4 only.
Standard BikeReg fee applied to on line registration.
Register Early and save!
Early Bird Discount until 7/9/16: Save $20 off of the day-of registration fee of $70.
Last Chance Discount until 7/16/16: Save $10 off of the day-of registration fee of $70.
Pre-registration from 7/17/16 until preregistration close, $65.
Day-of registration available until fields are full.
Refund policy:
80% refunds until 7/9/16, no questions asked.
7/10/16 until close of preregistration, we will transfer your entire entry fee to another rider, or give you an entry credit for next year's race.
Held under USA Cycling event permit. All USA Cycling Rules apply; approved helmets are mandatory; no mountain bikes, aero bars or straight bars.
There will be roll-out for any riders age 18 or younger immediately following their finish.
Races may be combined if less than 10 riders are pre-registered for a category.
USA Cycling license required.  One-day licenses for Cat 5 Men and Cat 4 Women may be purchased at registration for $10 for each day of racing. Please see note below regarding the 2014 rule change for One-Day License:One-Day Licenses.
1A2(c): The definition of a one-day license was tightened to make it clear that the license may only be purchased by someone who holds the lowest category for the discipline of the race. No rider who has previously held a higher category can purchase a one-day license. In other words, it is a beginner, trial license.
notes:
his year’s edition of our classic race returns to the Notchview Reservation in Windsor, MA. We've got the challenging Route 8A descent and the difficult East Hawley Road climb, along with the great racing you’ve come to expect. 

More race details on NCC's Website
directions:
Directions to Notchview Reservation: 

West on Route 9 from Northampton 29 miles to Windsor. Notchview Reservation is about one-mile east of Windsor Center and Rt. 8A.

title: NEBRA August Adventure
description:
Join the New England Bicycle Racing Association for a mixed medium bicycle ride through beautiful Western Massachusetts. Riders have a choice of two routes, 45 miles or 75 miles departing South Deerfield and heading north over backroads, dirt roads and bike paths. On returning to Deerfield enjoy a post ride pizza party catered by Hillside Organic Pizza. Beverages will be generously provided by Harpoon Brewing.

Riders can choose to ride solo, in groups or you can join small organized groups led by prominent members of the New England Cycling community. All proceeds from the ride will benefit the New England Bicycle Racing Association to help fund administration and programming.  

The August Adventure costs $70 per adult, $20 for riders under 19 years of age. Registration includes the full day's activities, post ride mean and beverages and a NEBRA swag bag full of goodies. Sig up online using the official registration service of NEBRA at www.bikereg.com/augustadventure. Sign up by July 1st and take $15 off an adult entry fee!

The ride will begin and end at Douglas Auctioneers, 241 Greenfield Road, S. Deerfield MA 01373. We are advertising a 10am start, but you may roll out anytime from 9:30 onward. This is a self guided ride- we will provide cue sheets and the route will be marked with arrows, but unless you are joining one of the small groups there will be no ride leaders.

This is a ride not a race- the roads are open to traffic so please obey the rules of the road and be courteous to other road users and local residents. We encourage you to stop often and enjoy the wonderful scenery, read the historic markers and take pictures!

All riders must wear an approved helmet. The ride will cover a variety of rolling terrain. Cyclocross or gravel bikes will be the most comfortable, though experienced riders will be fine on a road bike with 25-28mm tires.

We will have roving support staff and there will be two aid stations, but please plan to be self sufficient with food, water, a pump and a spare tube or two.

Your entry includes a post ride meal catered by Hillside Organic Pizza. We will have a variety of gourmet pizzas, including vegan and gluten free options. There will also be sandwich wraps, salad, snacks and dessert! If you have a food allergy please let us know before the event and we will do the best we can to accommodate you.
course: Mixed terrain, paved roads, dirt roads, dedicated bike paths
directions: Start-Finish at Douglas Auctioneers, 241 Greenfield Rd, S. Deerfield MA 01373

title: QuadCx 2016 Cyclocross
description: Grassroots New England Cyclocross race, for many riders QuadCross ia the season opener.  Back for our 10th year, the 6th at the Maynard Rod and Gun Club
course: Start in the field, along the pond, through the gravel pit, into the woods, past the cell phone tower, sharp left down the hill twisty bit, short goat trail, over the hill, 180 turn, up the long straight gravel road, 180 into the parking lot, past the race pit, through the sand pit, behind the pavilion back into the field, do it again.
notes: Course will run same direction as last two years, that is up the long straight gravel road.
directions:
From MA 2 go west on Route MA 62 4.1 miles, at a stop light turn left onto Waltham St, go .5 miles. Look for the Rod and Gun club sign on a phone pole on the the left. At the sign turn left onto Old Mill road. Follow Old Mill road .2 miles to the gun club. No on street parking please.
45 Old Mill Road, Maynard, MA 01754

title: CRAFT Sportswear Gran Prix of Gloucester
Fruitlands' Cup of Cyclocross
description: 2016 Fruitlands Cup of Cyclocross
course: Challenging 2+km course.  Family Museum admission included with race fee.
notes:
Note: Riders can race in additional races for $10. Start positions for Pre-registered riders determined by rider rankings at crossresults.com.
*First three Masters 35+ women will be scored separate for award recognition within the Women Open field.

Registration: Entry fee for all non-elite Adult races is $30. Elite races (Women’s Open and Men Pro 1/2/3) is $35. Entry fee for Juniors 15-18 is $20. Entry fee for Cub Juniors is $12.

Entries must be received by Thursday, October 22nd at 5:00 PM EST, or add $5.00 late fee. Entry Fee includes all applicable USA Cycling Insurance surcharge. No refunds on day of event. One Day licenses will be available for purchase ONLY for Cat 5 men and Cat 4 women. A one-day license is $15. All other participants must have an annual USAC licence. A license can be purchased through usacycling.org or at the event. Day-of registration opens at 7:30 AM. Riders must register at least 30 minutes prior to the start of their event.

Waitlists: For those fields that fill, a 25 person waitlist will open to sign up.  When fields close for pickup (30 min before start as stated above), riders on the waitlist will be called in order of registration subject to space availability.  Riders that are called from the waitlist but are not present to claim a spot will forfeit the entry fee.  For those that are present to claim a spot and cannot due to the field being full, the entry fee will be refunded on site.
